newsitem.title: GERMANY: Union to meet Lufthansa to seek end to pay dispute.
newsitem.headline: Union to meet Lufthansa to seek end to pay dispute.

text.p: Germany's DAG white-collar trade union said on Tuesday that it planned to meet German airline Lufthansa AG to seek an end to the pay dispute between the two parties.
DAG said that it and the OeTV public sector and transport union would meet Lufthansa together to find a solution to the continuing pay dispute.
DAG said that it accepted the OeTV agreement with Lufthansa made previously.
"Any long-term presentation of employee interests to secure jobs requires a merging of our strengths as trade unions," the OeTV chief Herbert Mai and DAG head Roland Issen said in a joint statement.

Up until now both unions have negotiated separately. There were some areas of agreement still to be reached between the two unions, the joint statement ran, which would be discussed at a meeting on April 7.

On October 25 last year the OeTV union agreed a settlement with Lufthansa, which involved a one-off payment of up to 33 percent of monthly pay and a wage increase of 1.7 percent. The wage agreement runs until the end of 1998.
